intro: Tetragonocarpus teysmannii, commonly known as the Malayan tamarind tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and compound leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers followed by woody pods containing edible seeds. Its botanical features include four-winged fruits, which are a distinguishing trait of the genus Tetragonocarpus. The tree is valued for its timber and has traditional uses in local medicine.
